unnormalised: My train to Kolkata was scheduled to depart at 6:30 AM on 10/11/2024. I had carefully prepone'd all my work so I could catch it. I even set 3 alarms, one at 4:00 AM, another at 4:15 AM, and a final one at 4:30 AM. You see, missing this train wasn't an option, as my cousin's wedding was on 12/11/2024 and I was responsible for bringing the 'haldi' from Delhi.

I even set three alarms, one at four A-M, another at four fifteen A-M, and a final one at four thirty A-M. You see, missing this train wasn't an option, as my cousin's wedding was on twelfth november two thousand and twenty four and I was responsible for bringing the 'haldi' from Delhi.

unnormalised: The problem wasn't waking up, it was getting to the station. Ola showed an estimated arrival time of 5:45 AM, leaving me just enough time to navigate the chaos of New Delhi Railway Station. The app warned of surge pricing, showing ₹450 instead of the usual ₹250. I sighed, but accepted, knowing the wedding and family expectations were on the line.

unnormalised: The auto-rickshaw ride itself was a blur. We dodged buses, scooters, and even a stray cow, arriving at the station precisely at 6:00 AM. I thanked the driver profusely and rushed inside, checking the platform number on the display board. "Kolkata Mail, Platform 5, Expected Departure: 6:30 AM", it read. Relief washed over me.

unnormalised: But then, disaster struck. A sudden announcement blared through the speakers: "Train number 12345, Kolkata Mail, scheduled to depart at 6:30 AM on 10/11/2024, is delayed by 2 hours due to unforeseen circumstances. Revised departure time: 8:30 AM". My heart sank. 2 hours! What would I do? The haldi ceremony was at 10:00 AM on the 12th. This delay could throw everything off.

unnormalised: Then, an idea struck. My friend, Riya, was taking a flight to Kolkata that same day! I quickly called her. After a 5 min conversation, and a little bit of convincing, she agreed to take the haldi with her, she was due to take off at 11:00 AM, reaching Kolkata at 1:30 PM. I just needed to get the haldi to her on time. This was a logistical challenge but definitely better than missing my cousin's wedding. She was flying Indigo Airlines, flight number 6E202.

unnormalised: I decided to use the delay to my advantage. I messaged my relatives to explain the change in plans and rushed to the nearest Haldiram’s to grab a box of sweets for Riya as a thank you. The situation was far from ideal, but a combination of technology and a friend's support had turned a potential disaster into a manageable inconvenience. And hopefully, the Kolkata Mail wouldn’t get delayed further!
